answerBox.snippet: Examine for lines to determine that your piece is ivory. When you examine your piece under a magnifying glass, if you are looking at ivory, there will be lines on the surface. The lines on genuine ivory can appear in a variety of ways, including straight, cross-hatched, or in a circular motion.

organic.snippet: Take a sewing needle or pin, heat it up over a candle flame, and stick the hot needle into the back of the piece. If the needle goes in easily, it's plastic.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Does all ivory have Schreger lines?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The main criterion to identify ivory is the presence of Schreger lines, which are present only in Proboscidean material. The angle formed by the Schreger lines can be used to differentiate between extant (recently living) African and Asian elephants, and extinct Proboscidea (mammoths), as explained below.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: A Case Study of Ivory Species Identification Using a Combination ...

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How valuable is real ivory?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: And given that ivory sells for approximately $3,300 per pound, poachers have plenty of motivation to continue killing elephants for their tusks. Indeed, entire criminal networks exist to engage in the ivory trade. And in recent years, the amount of ivory seized by law enforcement has been on the rise.
